message_1: What is the amount of energy required to break the single C-H bond in the methane (CH4) molecule? Provide the answer in units of kilojoules per mole (kJ/mol).
message_2: The energy required to break a single C-H bond in a methane (CH4) molecule is known as the bond dissociation energy. The bond dissociation energy for a C-H bond in methane is approximately 439 kJ/mol.
